document.docAuthor: Calhau, Julia, Lamas, Carlos José Einicker & Nihei, Silvio Shigueo
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Gauromydas giant flies (Insecta, Diptera, Mydidae), with descriptions of two new species from Central and South America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Gauromydas giant flies (Insecta, Diptera, Mydidae), with descriptions of two new species from Central and South America

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Antenna 1.4 times longer than head width; postpedicel often orange, but sometimes with proximal portion black; proximal and distal portions subequal in length; distal portion of postpedicel 5 times longer than wide. Scutum velvety black with four discrete white pruinose stripes (not seen in several old specimens). Male hind femur 2.5 times wider than hind tibia. Hind tibia with well-developed ventral keel and apical spur. Hind tarsomere 1 two times longer than wide, and slightly shorter than tarsomere 5 . T 1 velvety–black, golden or black setulose, remaining tergites with black setulae. Wing membrane whitish (more often), brown or orange, with apex and posterior margin hyaline; alula higher than wide. T 2–7 black, with or without a faint green metallic reflection. Male epandrial lamellae trapezoidal with external posterior extremity distinctly prolonged as a spine; phallic crest and lateral projections conspicuous. Female terminalia with membranous furca (
Fig.
4
I). Length: 32–70 mm .

Distribution (
Fig. 6
, Table 1 ). Brazil (Bahia, Espírito Santo, Goiás, Mato Grosso, Minas Gerais, Paraná, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo), Paraguay (Concepción).

Non-type material examined .
